Detailed Description

Parses real-world element description files.

The Document Type Definition for those element data files follows: 

<!ELEMENT chemical_element_list (chemical_element*)>

<!ELEMENT chemical_element (
        name,
        abundance,
        atomic_weight,
        nucleons?,
        electrons,
        neutron_scattering_length?,
        neutron_scattering_cross_section?,
        xray_scattering_anomalous_coefficients?
)>
<!ATTLIST chemical_element
        symbol  CDATA   #REQUIRED
>

<!ELEMENT atomic_weight EMPTY>
<!ATTLIST atomic_weight
        val     CDATA   #REQUIRED
        unit    CDATA   "g/mol"
>

<!ELEMENT nucleons EMPTY>
<!ATTLIST nucleons
        val     CDATA   #REQUIRED
>

<!ELEMENT name EMPTY>
<!ATTLIST name
        val     CDATA   #REQUIRED
>

<!ELEMENT electrons EMPTY>
<!ATTLIST electrons
        val     CDATA   #REQUIRED
>

<!ELEMENT abundance EMPTY>
<!ATTLIST abundance
        val     CDATA   #REQUIRED
>

<!ELEMENT neutron_scattering_length (coherent?, incoherent?)>
<!ATTLIST neutron_scattering_length
        factor  CDATA   "1e-15"
        unit    CDATA   "m"
>

<!ELEMENT neutron_scattering_cross_section (coherent?, incoherent?, total?, absorption?)>
<!ATTLIST neutron_scattering_cross_section
        factor  CDATA   "1e-24"
        unit    CDATA   "cmÂ²"
>

<!ELEMENT coherent EMPTY>
<!ATTLIST coherent
        re      CDATA   #REQUIRED
        im      CDATA   "0.0"
>

<!ELEMENT incoherent EMPTY>
<!ATTLIST incoherent
        re      CDATA   #REQUIRED
        im      CDATA   "0.0"
>

<!ELEMENT total EMPTY>
<!ATTLIST total
        val     CDATA   #REQUIRED
>

<!-- absorption cross section for 2200 m/s neutrons -->
<!ELEMENT absorption EMPTY>
<!ATTLIST absorption
        val     CDATA   #REQUIRED
>

<!ELEMENT xray_scattering_anomalous_coefficients (ev*)>
<!ATTLIST xray_scattering_anomalous_coefficients
        unit    CDATA   "keV"
>

<!ELEMENT ev EMPTY>
<!ATTLIST ev
        val     CDATA   #REQUIRED
        fp      CDATA   #REQUIRED
        fpp     CDATA   #REQUIRED
>

Definition at line 49 of file xmlparser.h.

typedef void(XmlParser::* XmlParser::XmlTokenHandler)(void) [private]

Prototype of a function to handle all the XML tokens a QXmlStreamReader may encounter.

Those are defined in enum QXmlStreamReader::TokenType.

Definition at line 46 of file xmlparser.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum XmlParser::SectionType [private]

Descibes the current element configuration state.

Enumerator:
IGNORED_SECTION 

Outside the element configuration.

ELEMENT_CONFIG_SECTION 

Inside the element configuration.

NS_L_SECTION 

Neutron scattering length parameter within the element configuration.

NS_C_SECTION 

Neutron scattering cross section parameter within the element configuration.

XRAY_COEFFICIENTS_SECTION 

Xray scattering factors within the element configuration.

Member Function Documentation

void XmlParser::handleCharacters ( void   )  [private]

Handles QXmlStreamReader::Characters.

Raises an error if there are characters except whitspace. The current Document Type Definition does not allow this.

void XmlParser::handleDTD ( void   )  [private]

Handles QXmlStreamReader::DTD.

Tests the current DTD name and raises an error if it is unknown.

void XmlParser::handleEndElement ( void   )  [private]

Handles QXmlStreamReader::EndDocument.

Updates the current configuration section and tests the recently configured chemical element for validity.

See also:

Definition at line 60 of file xmlparser.cpp.

References DBG, and mXml.

void XmlParser::handleStartElement ( void   )  [private]

Handles QXmlStreamReader::StartElement.

Creates and configures an chemical element eventually. This depends on the name and attributes of the xml element as well as the current section for this configuration.

See also:
SectionType

const XmlParser::ElementPtrList & XmlParser::read ( const QString &  filename  ) 

Reads decriptions of elements from file.

Parameters:
[in] filename Filename of a XML file containing one or more descriptions of real-world elements. This file has to be valid according to the Document Type Definition above.
Returns:
A list of all new elements extracted from the specified file.
